title: Bug 44164 - Update needed in javadoc for constructor Image(Device , ImageData)
description: Bug 44164 - Update needed in javadoc for constructor Image(Device , ImageData). Import org.eclipse.swt.widgets. Public class TestImageInvalidImage. Public static void main(String[] args) { ImageData data = new ImageData(10, 10, 1, new PaletteData(0xff0000, 0x00ff00, 0x0000ff)); Image image = new Image(Display.getDefault(), data); // image.dispose(); }
OB: When utilizing the constructor for Image(Device , ImageData), there is a possibility of encountering org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Unsupported color depth.
EB: The javadoc documentation should include information about the potential exception, specifically mentioning that the constructor can throw org.eclipse.swt.SWTException with the message 'Unsupported color depth.'
SR:
To reproduce this issue, follow these steps:
1. Create an instance of ImageData with specific parameters, including a PaletteData with unsupported color depth.
2. Instantiate an Image using the mentioned ImageData and the Display's default instance.
